content.description:
The best line on the boulder, Logarithm is a must-do for the area. It's also destined to become a popular warmup given its friendly holds, flowing sequences, and convenient location.  

  Begin down and to the left with your left hand on an edge under a little steepish wall. Work up and right, eventually gaining the left-facing corner/fin. Continue up this feature to the top.  

  It's possible to start farther right, but this lessens the number of moves and the quality of the problem.

Log Splitter climbs just right of Logarithm.  Start on on two obvious crimps for your hands and stand onto the wall using small footholds. Make a big move up to a shelf, and then top out straight up. Avoid using holds on Logarithm.

Stand start on the obvious holds just to the left of Logarithm , climb straight up through a crimp rail, to the interesting top out. 

  This can be climbed from the start of Logarithm  and has potential for a left hand start as  well.
content.location: Two feet to the left of Logarithm .

content.description: Hatchet is the right-most line on the wall. Start with a crimp for your left hand and a sidepull/pinch with your right. Put your feet on the wall and make an off-balance throw to the good sidepull. Establish on the sidepull and surf this corner-feature to the top.

This boulder is the first good-sized boulder you'll come to as you head up into the boulderfield. It's located about 50 yards from the stream.  

  This is a great place to start your day, as the Log Boulder has good warm ups, and is a great first stop because it's low on the hill.
